About me

Hi there, welcome to my portfolio page! I'm Alex, a 3rd year student currently studying Computer Science @ UBC in Vancouver.

I'm interested in leveraging technologies to develop, automate, and optimize software and systems to promote company growth and efficiency. Outside of work, I enjoy playing badminton, swimming, hiking, and camping with friends!

Feel free to download my resume, look around my GitHub, contact me at alex.ly.yeung@gmail.com, or connect on LinkedIn. I'm always excited to make new friends and meet new people!

Experience

Angel Host - Software Engineering Intern

  • Optimized operations and developed new features across multiple company websites and databases with 1000+ properties using React, TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js, and MySQL

  • Automated a property onboarding process that transfers listing information across multiple property management platforms using Python, REST APIs, JavaScript, and SQL, accelerating the previous manual process by over 5x for 300+ new listings and for all future listings

  • Built a prompt generation software, using Python, SQL, and ChatGPT’s API that generates crucial copywriting information for listings, reducing copywriting time from 3 hours to 20 minutes per listing

Ioto International - Software Engineering Intern

  • Implemented collision handling algorithms and optimized fetch and load database operations, which greatly reduced bulk-loading errors and optimized database transactions, using Python, NumPy, Pandas, Cypher QL, Docker, and AWS services via Boto3

  • Developed federal web scrapers to asynchronously extract extensive data from 330+ Canadian MPs for sentiment analysis, which reduced memory overhead and execution times using Asyncio, Aiohttp, and Playwright

Amazon Web Services - AWS DeepRacer Student Finalist

  • DeepRacer allows college students to use machine learning to train RL car models in simulated race track environments and race others around the globe in virtual competitions

  • Developed optimal reward functions to achieve the fastest race times for a variety of tracks using Python and reinforcement learning

  • Ranked 8th internationally out of 2000+ competitors by the end of April’s competition and was awarded a physical model of the DeepRacer car

My Projects

TechHorizons

A comprehensive full-stack e-commerce platform, showcasing a robust integration of modern web technologies and best practices. The development of TechHorizons was driven by a personal ambition to create an e-commerce platform to sell a diverse array of tech gadgets and innovations. This project has also been pivotal in improving full-stack development skills, with a focus on scalable architecture, secure authentication, and building an intuitive user experience.

This project involved developing the frontend with Vue.js for product, product details, and cart pages, and the backend with Node.js and Express.js for REST API calls, using Axios for front to back-end communication. MongoDB was used for database storage. Authentication was handled with Google Firebase, allowing individual cart access after signing-in, and the application was deployed using Render.

See Project See Live

Educational Planner

This application is an educational planner that allows students to keep track of their overall averages in each of their courses using the grades they input from each of their course's assignments.

Some schools may not offer software that allows their students to continuously track their progress and evaluate their academic weak points. In today's educational environment, being able to keep track of your grades and continuously improve academically is crucial to getting accepted into a good university or graduate program, which may eventually help in procuring a successful career.

See Project

Face Detection Website

This is a web-based project that allows users to upload an image URL and send the image to be processed by the backend, which detects and draws borders around faces in the image using a REST API.

This website uses React, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Clarifai (REST API). It was developed to show the capabilities of machine learning and to refine skills in web development.

See Project
